snippet: A 4 percent global decline is fueled by a steep dive in Japan, where digital has barely taken hold.
abstract: Report by International Federation of the Phonographic Industry finds that wholesale revenue from recorded music around the world in 2013 fell by 3.9 percent as compared with year before, to $15 billion, even as revenue from online streaming services increases; decline is fueled by steep dive in Japan, where digital has barely taken hold.
lead_paragraph: A 4 percent global decline is fueled by a steep dive in Japan, where digital has barely taken hold.

headline.main: Music Sales Fell in 2013, Even as Streaming Revenue Increased
headline.print_headline: Sales of Music Fell in 2013, Even as Streaming Increased

keywords.value: International Federation of the Phonographic Industry
keywords.name: organizations
